intro: Duosperma angolense, commonly known as the Angola spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in drought-tolerant gardens.
